intro: Lisianthius pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered lisianthius, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
